abstract: Apple’s earnings leapt ahead of analysts’ expectations on record Macintosh sales, showing the company is joining the league of dominant computer makers, Hewlett-Packard and Dell.
snippet: Apple’s earnings leapt ahead of analysts’ expectations on record Macintosh sales, showing the company is joining the league of dominant computer makers, Hewlett-Packard and Dell.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 22 — Apple’s earnings report today leapt ahead of analysts’ already optimistic expectations. The company posted record Macintosh sales numbers for its fiscal fourth quarter, showing that the company is climbing into the league of the dominant personal computer makers, Hewlett-Packard and Dell.

headline.main: Apple Profit Up 67%, Aided by Record Mac Sales

abstract: Apple’s share of the personal computer market is surging, driven in part by what analysts call a halo effect from the iPod and the iPhone.
snippet: Apple’s share of the personal computer market is surging, driven in part by what analysts call a halo effect from the iPod and the iPhone.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 21 — It may have dropped the word “computer” from its name, but Apple is certainly selling plenty of Macs.

headline.main: As Apple Gains PC Market Share, Jobs Talks of a Decade of Upgrades
headline.print_headline: As Apple Gains PC Market Share, Jobs Talks of a Decade of Upgrades

abstract: An interesting tidbit from the Apple earnings call: Of the 1.4 million iPhones sold so far, perhaps 250,000 of them were sold to people who wanted to unlock them from the AT&T network.
snippet: An interesting tidbit from the Apple earnings call: Of the 1.4 million iPhones sold so far, perhaps 250,000 of them were sold to people who wanted to unlock them from the AT&T network.
lead_paragraph: Apple’s earnings calls are notoriously devoid of information, but Apple’s chief operating officer, Timothy Cook, did drop one interesting figure.

headline.main: Apple: $100 Million Spent on Potential iBricks
